Package org.neo4j.internal.kernel.api

Interface NodeValueIndexCursor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, AutoCloseablePlus, Cursor, IndexResultScore, NodeIndexCursor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultNodeValueIndexCursor, FullAccessNodeValueIndexCursor, NodeValueIndexCursor.Empty, StubNodeValueIndexCursor
    public interface NodeValueIndexCursor
extends NodeIndexCursor
    Cursor for scanning the property values of nodes in a schema index.

    Usage pattern: 

    
     int nbrOfProps = cursor.numberOfProperties();

     Value[] values = new Value[nbrOfProps];
     while ( cursor.next() )
     {
         if ( cursor.hasValue() )
         {
             for ( int i = 0; i < nbrOfProps; i++ )
             {
                 values[i] = cursor.propertyValue( i );
             }
         }
         else
         {
             values[i] = getPropertyValueFromStore( cursor.nodeReference(), cursor.propertyKey( i ) )
         }

         doWhatYouWantToDoWith( values );
     }

    • Method Detail

      • numberOfProperties

        int numberOfProperties()
        Returns:
        the number of properties accessible within the index, and thus from this cursor.

      • propertyKey

        int propertyKey​(int offset)

      • hasValue

        boolean hasValue()
        Check before trying to access values with propertyValue(int). Result can change with each call to Cursor.next().
        Returns:
        true if propertyValue(int) can be used to get property value on cursor's current location, else false.

      • propertyValue

        Value propertyValue​(int offset)
